parse.title: Slayer assignment
parse.text:
Slayer task
Slayer task completed!

A Slayer assignment or Slayer task is given by Slayer masters. When you kill the assigned monsters, you get Slayer experience, which you wouldn't if it weren't your assignment. In addition, some monsters killed as part of a slayer assignment either have improved drop rates for specific item(s) and access to drop(s) that are otherwise unobtainable if killed off-task.

A Slayer assignment may be changed once per assignment with the use of Slayer points. Right-click on a Slayer master to select 'Rewards', then select the 'Assignment' tab:

  • Cancel task (30 points)
  • Block task (100 points)
  • Extend task (30 points)
  • Prefer task (100 points)

It is only possible to cancel, block, extend or prefer the assignment after it is assigned. There is a maximum limit of 8 types of assignments that can be blocked or preferred on one account - one prefer and block slot for every 50 quest points up to a maximum of 400 quest points. Each action of blocking or preferring assignment costs 100 Slayer points. Players cannot extend an assignment that is the same as their previous assignment; for instance, if a player completes an assignment of greater demons and is subsequently reassigned them, they will not be able to extend it, regardless of whether they extended the first task.

Slayer assignments can also sometimes be abandoned by talking to Turael/Spria, who may give an easier assignment if the player talks to them. This always works if the assignment is for a creature that they do not normally assign, and it will also work if the player is on a special Slayer challenge. Normally, Turael and Spria will not reassign a task if they can assign that creature themselves. Abandoning an assignment comes at the cost of terminating the player's active task streak and resetting it to zero.

Contents

  • 1 Slayer assignment by master
  • 2 Slayer categories
    • 2.1 Former and unused Slayer assignments
  • 3 Slayer challenges
  • 4 Slayer assignments in the God Wars Dungeon
  • 5 Update history
  • 6 Trivia
  • 7 References

Slayer challenges[edit | edit source]

Main article: Slayer/Challenges
Task Monsters needed to kill Slayer master
Slay all monsters in the basement of Turael/Spria. 1,000 extra Slayer XP rewarded. 2 level 5 goblins, 2 level 11 goblins, 1 level 13 goblin, 2 level 11 wolves, 3 level 14 wolves, 5 level 12 minotaurs. /
Kill Dragith Nurn in the Lumbridge Catacombs. 1,000 extra Slayer XP rewarded, as well as 5 Slayer points. Dragith Nurn
Investigate the fairy rings in Morytania. 2,000 extra Slayer XP rewarded, as well as 3 Slayer points. Level 42 ravenous ghoul, level 72 ravenous vampyre, level 33 ravenous snail.
Bring him one scale of each type of chromatic dragon. 4,000 extra Slayer XP rewarded, as well as 14 Slayer points. Each type of chromatic dragon (not 100% drop, so might be more than one each).
Slay undead creatures in or around the crypt in the Wilderness north of Fort Forinthry, 3,000 extra Slayer XP rewarded. Normal slayer XP for killing each monster is not rewarded. 120-149 of the following creatures (every creature counts as a certain amount of kills):
  • Fetid zombies (1 kill each)
  • Bound skeletons (2 kills each)
  • Risen ghosts (3 kills each)
  • Armoured phantoms (4 kills each)
Test her new experimental fungicide spray on ten mutated zygomites. 10,000 extra Slayer XP rewarded, as well as 25 Slayer points. 10 mutated zygomites, which might full heal, or heal a bit and become stronger because of the spray.
Kill the Kalphite Queen. 15,000 extra Slayer XP rewarded, as well as 30 Slayer points. Kalphite Queen
Kill all creatures in the Slayer Tower, without leaving. 20,000 extra Slayer XP rewarded, as well as 35 Slayer points. 21 crawling hands, 8 banshees, 9 Infernal mages, 7 bloodveld, 7 aberrant spectres, 5 gargoyles, 6 nechryaels and 6 abyssal demons. /
Kill 280 Volcanic creatures (inside the TzHaar Fight Cave). If TzTok-Jad is killed, 25,000 extra Slayer XP rewarded, otherwise only 12,000 extra Slayer XP is rewarded. 280 volcanic creatures (from the TzHaar Fight Cave)
Kill a list of bosses. These bosses must be killed solo. After killing a boss you will obtain a dark crystal. You need to bring all dark crystals you have to every boss. Each dark crystal has a debuff that weakens the player. It is recommended to do the stronger bosses first, and the weaker bosses last. 50,000 Slayer XP rewarded, as well as 45 Slayer points.
  • Giant Mole (hard mode)
  • Kalphite Queen
  • Dagannoth Kings
  • King Black Dragon
  • Queen Black Dragon
  • Kree'arra
  • Commander Zilyana
  • K'ril Tsutsaroth
  • General Graardor
  • Araxxor
Gather a dose of poison from each of the Vile blooms. Each enemy only has to be killed once to receive the poison. 50,000 Slayer XP rewarded, as well as 45 Slayer points.

1 devil's snare, 1 luminous snaggler, 1 lampenflora, 1 liverworts

Kill multiple foes found in the Wilderness or elsewhere in Gielinor 15 times. Killing 4 bosses found exclusively in the Wilderness awards additional Slayer XP. 21,500 Slayer XP (30,000 XP if killing all four optional bosses), as well as 35 Slayer points. 15 abyssal demons, 15 acheron mammoths, 15 black demons, 15 greater demon ash lords or berserkers, 15 hellhounds, 15 hydrix dragons, 15 ice strykewyrms, 15 Kal'gerion demons, 15 lava strykewyrms, 15 revenants, 15 ripper demons, 15 soulgazers, 15 waterfiends

Optional: Chaos Elemental, Corporeal Beast, King Black Dragon, Wildywyrm

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 8 July 2024 (Update):
    • Fixed a typo in the message that players receive upon finishing a Slayer Task without previously finishing the Smoking Kills quest.
  • patch 15 January 2024 (Update):
    • Laniakea's special task can now be cancelled using Slayer points, just like all the other special tasks.
  • patch 24 April 2023 (Update):
    • The Edimmu resource dungeon is now accessible with suitable Slayer Tasks such as ghost, zombie, undead, Creatures of Daemonheim, and Edimmu selected.
  • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Updated Undead Slayer categories gamewide.
    • Monsters will more consistently appear in different Undead categories for the purposes of Slayer.
    • Skeletal creatures such as Skeletal Wyverns are now treated as Undead, and will work for Skeleton and Undead tasks.
    • Creatures such as Banshees will work for Ghost and Undead Slayer tasks.
    • Edimmu will work for Ghost, Zombie and Undead Slayer tasks.
    • Added an Undead cluster task to Laniakea.
  • patch 16 January 2023 (Update):
    • Players won't receive 'Nothing' as a slayer task anymore.
  • patch 5 September 2022 (Update):
    • Mandrith's slayer challenge reworked with the old list removed, as fire giants had been removed from the Wilderness following its rehaul.
  • patch 6 September 2021 (Update):
    • Players will no longer be assigned random Slayer tasks when wearing particular masks.
  • hotfix 9 August 2021 (Update):
    • Ironmen will now be awarded drops and progress on their Slayer Tasks when using siege cannons against the Nodon.
  • patch 26 July 2021 (Update):
    • Slayer Task streaks can now increase beyond 16,000
    • The correct amount of Slayer Points will now be awarded upon Task completion.
  • patch 19 July 2021 (Update):
    • Getting a new Slayer Task from Sumona will no longer cause unexpected logouts.
  • patch 12 July 2021 (Update):
    • Users logging in to an account with an invalid slayer task with now have their slayer task removed.
    • Players that were unable to progress their slayer task will now be able to claim a new task on login.
  • patch 6 July 2020 (Update):
    • Tips for the frog Slayer task are now correct.
  • patch 2 March 2020 (Update):.
    • Imps in the God Wars Dungeon will now count towards demon Slayer tasks.
  • patch 3 February 2020 (Update):
    • Non-direct combat methods can now be utilized to progress a variety of slayer tasks that previously could not be progressed in this manner.
  • patch 20 January 2020 (Update):
    • "Demons" cluster slayer assignment now counts imps as demons.
  • patch 6 January 2020 (Update):
    • Creatures of Daemonheim Slayer task now include all creatures.
    • Corrected some task-specific loot script that didn't always check against all NPCs' Slayer categories (Revenant dark beast counts as a revenant, a ghost and a dark beast for this purpose, for example)
  • patch 19 August 2019 (Update):
    • Slayer assignment for Cres's Automatons tip no longer mentions Grotworms.
  • patch 25 March 2019 (Update):
    • Players can now complete their slayer task if they had previously reset their wilderness task to an easier one.
  • patch 22 May 2017 (Update):
    • Sumona can no longer give slayer assignments to underleveled players.
  • patch 11 January 2016 (Update):
    • Fixed a typo when attempting to get a slayer task while on a special assignment.
  • ninja 7 July 2014 (Update):
    • Due to player feedback, the slayer task completion message is now green.
  • patch 23 June 2014 (Update):
    • The music played when a Slayer task is completed has been updated.
  • ninja 23 June 2014 (Update):
    • Players can now block a seventh Slayer task with a total of 350 Quest Points.
    • The slayer task completion message is now red.
  • patch 10 September 2013 (Update):
    • Players attempting to force a slayer assignment with a mask will now be given a message in chat if they don't have the requirements for that assignment.
  • patch 13 August 2013 (Update):
    • After declining a Slayer challenge, players can now force a Slayer task using their Slayer masks.
  • patch 18 March 2013 (Update):
    • Players on free worlds can now change their slayer tasks properly if they were previously a member.
  • patch 28 January 2013 (Update):
    • Killing Black demons whilst Dungeoneering will now count towards a Slayer assignment.
  • patch 26 July 2011 (Update):
    • Mutated jadinkos are now given as a Slayer task.
  • patch 3 May 2011 (Update):
    • Cave bugs will no longer be assigned as a Slayer task to players with very low combat stats, and their regeneration rate has been lowered.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • As of 30 January 2023, hobgoblin Slayer assignments had the highest completion rate with over 99%.[2]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Daze's Twitter account. 7 August 2018. (Archived from the original on 20 December 2019.) Mod Daze: "Talk to the guy on the surface and it should unlock then." In response to the question: "Can someone explain to me why... I can't pick aviensies?"
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Sponge's Twitter account. 30 January 2023. (Archived from the original on 1 March 2023.) Mod Sponge: "[Stat of the day (kinda) Which slayer task do you think has the highest completion rate (by percentage)?] Hobgoblins, the answer was hobgoblins. With above 99% completion rate."
